CONGRATULATIONS!!

Congratulations to Landri Salmon on her selection to represent Memorial Elementary as an outstanding student leader in the Illinois Principals Association Abe Lincoln Region. We are all so proud of her accomplishments, but just as importantly, we are thankful that Landri's strengths in leadership bring out the best in others as well, Principal Bruder noted. Mrs. DeClerck (4th grade teacher) had this to say regarding Landri, "Landri proves to be a leader in all areas. She excelled at being a role model for her peers. She is always willing to step up and help a friend in need, whether it be academically or otherwise. Landri motivates her peers to read and be creative. She is an overall great leader among her classmates."

Since the IPA breakfast has been cancelled, the Abe Lincoln Region will issue a certificate and will also recognize Landri's leadership award virtually. We wish Landri all the best as she prepares to continue her educational journey next year at Taylorville Junior High School.

We have the technology!!! Stephanie Ogle (EIASE), asked for help printing mask buckles. So we stepped up and started printing some yesterday. We can do about 1 every 15 minutes on each 3D Printer. We have 4 setup and running currently.

From Stephanie
"Do any of my friends have a 3D printer that they'd be willing to help us with the mask buckles? We can send you a file to print at your home (20 buckles is roughly a 4-hr print) or if you wanted us to handle it at our home, we can do that, too. The 3D printer we are using is running almost 24 hours a day, and we are behind on getting them sent out. We have had requests for almost 500 buckles in 17 states so far (wow!)"

So glad we can help out!!!
